Merchant network at the core of Fino’s small finance bank bid | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Merchant network at the core of Fino’s small finance bank bid

Publication Date: December 2023, Source: Live Mint

Fino Payments Bank is seeking to convert into a small finance bank, planning to utilize its extensive merchant network for lending and loan collection services.

  • Fino has about 1.8 million merchants providing financial services.
  • The proposal was made to the regulator for approval in December 2023.
  • Managing Director Rishi Gupta emphasized the potential of merchants as loan collection points.
“A significant portion of these merchants can be used to collect loan repayments.” - Rishi Gupta

This proposal marks a strategic move by Fino Payments Bank to expand its customer base while leveraging existing resources effectively.
newTitle: Fino Payments Bank Leverages Merchant Network for Small Finance Bank Proposal

Bitcoin (BTC) Dips Below $98K, Ethereum's ETH, Cardano's ADA, Dogecoin Tumbled Over 10% in Crypto Correction - CoinDesk
summary:
Bitcoin Dips Below $96K While CoinDesk 20 Plunges 10% Amid Fed-Spurred Rout; SOL Surrenders Post-Election Rally

Date: Dec 19, 2024, Source: CoinDesk

The cryptocurrency market faced a significant downturn on December 19, with Bitcoin dropping below $96,000 amidst a wider market selloff driven by Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's comments regarding interest rates. The correction saw Bitcoin dipping 4.8% in 24 hours, with altcoins like Ethereum and Cardano also experiencing considerable losses of over 10%.

  • Bitcoin's price traded around $98,000 before falling below $96,000.
  • The CoinDesk 20 Index dropped over 10% during this period.
  • Nearly $1.2 billion in leveraged crypto derivatives positions were liquidated.
  • Traditional markets also reacted, with slight gains that eroded during trading.
  • Experts suggest this pullback may be healthy following the substantial rise in prices.
"The crypto market has already been on pins and needles around the possibility for a correction following the record run in the price of bitcoin through $100,000," said Joel Kruger, market strategist at LMAX Group.

This market correction highlights the volatility inherent in the cryptocurrency space and the influence of external economic factors, such as decisions made by the Federal Reserve.
newTitle: Bitcoin Dips Below $96K as Crypto Market Faces Major Correction

title: Rupee breaches 85/$ for 1st time on Fed's comment of fewer rate cuts in future - The Times of India
summary:
Rupee breaches 85/$ for 1st time on Fed's comment of fewer rate cuts in future

Date & Source: October 2023, Times of India

The Indian Rupee has crossed the 85 mark against the US dollar for the first time, triggering concerns among economists following comments from the Federal Reserve regarding fewer rate cuts in the future.

  • The Indian Rupee has depreciated due to inflationary pressures and economic uncertainties.
  • Federal Reserve hints at maintaining higher interest rates for an extended period.
  • The movement in the forex market reflects investor sentiment and market volatility.
"The rupee's performance is a direct consequence of external financial policies that directly impact Indian economic stability." - Market Analyst

This development could have significant implications for India's trade balance and inflation rates, necessitating close observation from policymakers.
newTitle: Rupee Breaches 85/$ Amid Federal Reserve's Rate Cut Comments

title: Ola Electric store count to touch 4,000 this Christmas; CEO Bhavish Aggarwal eyes presence in 'every town, city, tehsil' | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Ola Electric store count to touch 4,000 this Christmas; CEO Bhavish Aggarwal eyes presence in ’every town, city, tehsil’

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

Ola Electric aims to significantly increase its store presence to 4,000 by Christmas, with CEO Bhavish Aggarwal highlighting the affordability of electric vehicles.

  • Ola Electric anticipates reaching 4,000 stores by Christmas.
  • Customers can save around ₹4,000 per month by using Ola's electric vehicles.
  • New electric bike models were released on Independence Day in 2024: Roadster Pro, Roadster, and Roadster X.
  • Ola aims to integrate its own batteries into vehicles starting in the first quarter of the next financial year.
  • Ola's first electric scooter, the S1 Pro, was delivered in December 2021.
“With EVs, you will save ₹4,000 per month. Your savings will increase, and you'll save money with this savings wala scooter,” - Bhavish Aggarwal

Ola Electric’s expansion plans reflect its commitment to increasing accessibility to electric vehicles across various regions.
newTitle: Ola Electric Expands Store Count to 4,000 by Christmas

title: Accenture ushers in holiday season with $1.2 billion in Gen AI orders | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Accenture ushers in holiday season with $1.2 billion in Gen AI orders

Publication Date: December 5, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

Accenture Plc announced its generative AI bookings reached $1.2 billion for the quarter ending November 2024, indicating significant growth in client spending on new technology despite ongoing economic pressures.

  1. Accenture secured $1.2 billion in Gen AI bookings for the quarter, totaling $4.2 billion since September 2023.
  2. The company added 24,000 employees, primarily in India, reflecting business momentum.
  3. Julie Sweet, CEO, noted companies are prioritizing Gen AI spending within current budgets.
  4. Accenture's Gen AI bookings represented 6.4% of overall order bookings for the quarter.
  5. The overall revenue for the first quarter was reported at $17.69 billion, a rise of 7.8% sequentially.
“Right now, it still generally feels more like a prioritization within current budgets,” said Julie Sweet.

Despite strong Gen AI performance, Accenture remains cautious about macroeconomic conditions, suggesting potential challenges for future growth.
newTitle: Accenture Secures $1.2 Billion in Generative AI Orders, Signals Growth Amid Challenges

title: Bonus shares: KPI Green Energy announces January 3 as record date - CNBCTV18
summary:
KPI Green Energy Sets January 3 as Record Date for Bonus Shares

Publication Date: Latest Update Source: CNBC TV18

KPI Green Energy Ltd. has announced January 3 as the record date to determine the eligibility of shareholders for its proposed 1:2 bonus issue.

  • The bonus shares will be issued in the ratio of one equity share of ₹5 face value for every two existing shares held.
  • Subject to shareholder approval via postal ballot, the shares are expected to be dispatched by January 14, 2025.
  • The issuance will be drawn from the company's securities premium account as of March 31, 2024.
  • KPI Green has also signed a memorandum of understanding with the Rajasthan government for hybrid solar and wind power projects.
  • The company’s shares have surged 56.1% year-to-date, despite a 2.06% decline on the National Stock Exchange recently.
“The shares are expected to be dispatched within two months from the bonus issue recommendation date.”

This announcement signals positive growth for KPI Green Energy as it looks to enhance shareholder value and expand renewable energy projects in India.
newTitle: KPI Green Energy Sets January 3 as Record Date for Bonus Shares

The Fed's rate outlook has rattled markets. Here's what it means for global central banks - CNBC
summary:
The Fed's Rate Outlook Has Rattled Markets. Here's What It Means for Global Central Banks

Publication Date: December 19, 2024 | Source: CNBC

The U.S. Federal Reserve has recently raised its inflation outlook while signaling fewer rate cuts in the upcoming year, thereby affecting global interest rates.

  • The Fed's adjustments have led to significant volatility in global markets.
  • Jerome Powell indicated that the bank may only cut rates twice in 2025, which is less than previously anticipated.
  • A stronger U.S. dollar is anticipated as a result of the Fed's hawkish stance.
  • Emerging markets could face tougher financial conditions due to dollar strength.
  • Asian currencies, including the Japanese yen and Indian rupee, have been adversely affected.
  • Global central banks are reassessing their policies in light of the Fed's new outlook.
“When you have a more hawkish Fed, this will lead to a stronger U.S. dollar and a tightening of global financial conditions.” - Qian Wang, chief Asia-Pacific economist at Vanguard

The Fed's recent stance is expected to shape the global monetary landscape, influencing central bank strategies worldwide.
newTitle: Understanding the Federal Reserve's Impact on Global Central Banks Amid Rising Inflation

title: These 6 stocks hit 52-week highs, rallied up to 21% in a month - The Economic Times
summary:
These 6 stocks hit 52-week highs, rallied up to 21% in a month

Date: Dec 19, 2024   Source: ETMarkets.com

The stock market saw a significant drop of approximately 964 points on Thursday, yet six stocks from the BSE 200 index managed to hit their 52-week highs, demonstrating resilience amid market fluctuations.

  • Coforge reached a new high of Rs 9,670, increasing by 21% in the past month.
  • The Indian Hotels Company hit Rs 886.05, with a 19% gain over the month.
  • Mankind Pharma achieved a high of Rs 2,920.05, growing by 11% recently.
  • Muthoot Finance saw its stock rise to Rs 2,145, up 14% in a month.
  • Oracle Financial Services Software reached Rs 12,929.1, also rising by 14%.
  • Persistent Systems hit Rs 6,708, increasing by 19% in the same period.
The current metric of a 52-week high is crucial for assessing stock value and forecasting future potential.

This analysis of stocks reveals the persistent strength of certain companies, even in a volatile market.
newTitle: 6 Stocks Reached 52-Week Highs, Some Rising Up to 21% in a Month

title: Trade Setup for December 20: Nifty is facing its worst week in three months, can bulls turn the tide? - CNBCTV18
summary:
Trade Setup for December 20: Nifty is facing its worst week in three months, can bulls turn the tide?

Publication Date: December 20, 2023 | Source: CNBC TV18

The Nifty is experiencing its worst week in three months, facing a notable decline with a 250-point drop on Thursday. Despite the initial volatility, the index exhibited weak trading and encountered challenges in crossing key resistance levels.

  • Nifty experienced a significant drop, violating near-term support levels at 24,100 and 24,000.
  • Market participants are monitoring upcoming economic indicators, including the Bank of England policy meeting and Q3 US GDP numbers.
  • Eight IPOs are currently open for subscription, indicating a continued influx of new listings.
  • Foreign institutions were net sellers in the cash market, while domestic investors were net buyers.
  • Experts suggest potential for a relief rally but caution about weak short-term market sentiment and suggest key support levels for traders.
“For traders, the key support zones are at 23870/79000 and the 200-day SMA or 23825/78800.” - Shrikant Chouhan, Kotak Securities

The market outlook remains cautious, with analysts highlighting significant bearish momentum but also the potential for a rebound in the near term.
newTitle: Nifty Faces Challenges as Market Sees Significant Decline

US government urges high-ranking officials to lock down mobile devices following telecom breaches - TechCrunch
summary:
US Government Urges High-Ranking Officials to Lock Down Mobile Devices Following Telecom Breaches

Date: December 19, 2024 | Source: TechCrunch

The U.S. government has issued a warning for senior officials to improve the security of their mobile devices due to significant breaches involving Chinese cyber activities targeting major telecom companies.

  • The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) advised officials to activate enhanced security settings, such as Apple’s Lockdown Mode.
  • Officials are encouraged to use end-to-end encrypted messaging platforms like Signal to protect sensitive communications.
  • CISA emphasized the importance of encryption, stating it protects data even if breached.
  • Phishing-resistant multi-factor authentication and telecom-level account PINs are recommended to defend against SIM-swapping attacks.
“Encryption is your friend — it makes your data unreadable, even if the adversary were to compromise it,” said CISA executive assistant director Jeff Greene.

In summary, the U.S. government highlights the necessity for heightened security measures among key officials to mitigate ongoing risks associated with cyber threats.
newTitle: US Government Advises Officials to Secure Mobile Devices Amid Telecom Breaches

title: Bengaluru Techie Says She's Happier After Shifting to London: "It's An Overarching Feeling" - NDTV
summary:
Bengaluru Techie Says She's Happier After Shifting to London: "It's An Overarching Feeling"

Publication Date: December 18, 2024 | Source: Sayani B's Twitter

Sayani B, a software engineer from Bengaluru, shares her positive experience of relocating to London, emphasizing her enhanced happiness despite the city's high cost of living.

  • Sayani B explained her move to London and how it has improved her overall happiness.
  • She mentioned a sense of safety on London's public transport compared to experiences in Indian cities.
  • The post sparked a discussion comparing life in India versus abroad.
  • Users commented on various aspects of living in London such as cleaner air and walkability.
"It's been a couple of months living in London, and I am in general, happier. I can't point at what exactly has been a game changer, but it's an overarching feeling 🙂" — Sayani B

Her experience highlights not only the personal benefits of relocating but also raises discussions on the quality of life in different countries.

title: 'Didn't speak Hindi, not from IIT': Startup CEO reveals why he left Bengaluru in 16 months - Hindustan Times
summary:
Startup CEO's Struggles in Bengaluru: A Journey of Bias and Cultural Challenges

Publication Date: Dec 19, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Dhruv Suyamprakasam, the founder of iCliniq, shares his experience of leaving Bengaluru after facing investor biases and cultural challenges. Initially drawn to the city as a startup hub, he encountered obstacles due to his non-IIT background and limited Hindi proficiency.

  • Dhruv left Bengaluru after 16 months due to investor biases related to his education and language skills.
  • He realized Bengaluru's fast-paced startup culture didn't suit his healthcare business model.
  • After returning to Coimbatore, he faced challenges like unreliable internet and lack of a startup ecosystem.
  • Despite hoping for inclusivity, Dhruv found little change in the healthcare industry's environment upon returning to Bengaluru.
"I felt excluded because I didn't speak Hindi, and I wasn't an alumnus of the Indian Institute of Technology."

His journey reflects the complexities of navigating the startup landscape in India's Silicon Valley and the unique challenges faced by entrepreneurs outside major institutions.
newTitle: Startup CEO's Struggles in Bengaluru: A Journey of Bias and Cultural Challenges

title: Gold recovery loses steam ahead of US GDP, Jobless claims figures - FXStreet
summary:
Gold Prices Retreat Amid Positive U.S. Economic Data

Publication Date: November 13, 2023 Source: FXStreet

Gold has faced a short-lived recovery, with recent U.S. GDP and Jobless Claims data confirming strong economic performance, leading to a stronger U.S. Dollar and bearish pressure on gold prices.

  • Gold (XAU/USD) failed to rise above previous support at $2,625.
  • U.S. GDP for Q3 was reported at 3.1%, surpassing expectations.
  • Jobless claims fell to 220K, indicating a robust labor market.
  • The Federal Reserve cut rates but revised growth expectations upward.
  • The hawkish tone from Fed Chairman Jerome Powell has strengthened the U.S. Dollar.
“The central bank’s projections and an unusually hawkish tone... sent U.S. Treasury yields rallying.”

The recent U.S. economic data provides significant support to the dollar, jeopardizing gold's recovery potential.
newTitle: Gold Prices Retreat Amid Positive U.S. Economic Data
